formattedAddress: 97 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text:
This is a little heaven in east village. The garden is so cool and all employees are so welcoming and friendly.
All dishes I‚Äôve tried so far where so good too and I heard my neighbor table calling their meal the ‚Äúbest meal ever‚Äù.

The only change that I would love would be no plastic cups or containers.
It‚Äôs so much waste and drinking matcha out of a nice class or cup and eating acaii out of real bowls is just a different feeling and it fits the vibe way more.

originalText.text:
I attended a private event there. The poor waitress was brand new and alone which was shocking. She ran herself ragged, poor lady doing her best to handle a sizeable group by herself. She did her best and kudos to her, but the restaurant should have provided two servers.

The flat bread is delicious and I liked the burger dwluxe as well. I had the GF bun which is definitely made in house and seemed very healthy. I'd try the regular bun next time. They didn't have ketchup for the fries and I couldn't get any other sauce for dipping. My main complaint really is that sitting by the folding doors which were not latched into the closed position made my food cold very quickly due to the draft. My companion and I dined with our coats on. These issues all could have been dealt with easily if there was more staff on hand. I'd give them another shot, because I enjoyed the food.

The flat bread is delicious and I liked the burger dwluxe as well. I had the GF bun which is definitely made in house and seemed very healthy. I'd try the regular bun next time. They didn't have ketchup for the fries and I couldn't get any other sauce for dipping. My main complaint really is that sitting by the folding doors which were not latched into the closed position made my food cold very quickly due to the draft. My companion and I dined with our coats on. These issues all could have been dealt with easily if there was more staff on hand. I'd give them another shot, because I enjoyed the food.

originalText.text: This place was magical!. Lol.  This is a wonderful spot. Family owned business. The food here was awesome!.. Had the avocado flatbread. My friend had the burger and we had another flatbread dish.  Unfortunately, I cannot remember the name. They sell a tasty Pinot grigio named duck from Portugal. It paired well with my meal. Anyway, the flatbreads are great and filling. I was fortunate to meet the family that night and they provided excellent customer service. Lastly, the lasagna. The lasagna was awesome!! I was blown away. Some of the best lasagna I had.. ü§îü§îü§îmade the best. Lastly, special note to the owners. Thank you for the birthday lasagna!!! This is a place I have to come back to. Try some of this vegan food when y'all are on your drinking night..

Try some of this vegan food when y'all are on your drinking night..

originalText.text:
I remember Yaffa Cafe fondly so I was excited to try LUZ. They have a great patio space which is very nicely appointed. Friendly service.

I liked the flatbread with pesto - tasty would have liked more of the Ricotta. I personally didn‚Äôt find the  Romaesco very flavorful. The frozen oat milk ice cream was disappointing. There‚Äôs some really great vegan ice cream out there so not sure why this was such a miss.

I would go back to try the lasagna and have a glass of wine. They do have bowls which sound super healthy but didn‚Äôt inspire me in any way.

It would I have been nice to have a leafy green salad on the menu. Maybe something With a ginger carrot dressing for old time sake :)

If I lived closer I would drop by for a latte or glass of wine.
